summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Many people have written about the things that have happened among us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who saw everything from the first and helped teach the Good News have passed these things on to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear Theophilus, I have looked with care into these things from the beginning. I have decided it would be good to write them to you one after the other the way they happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you can be sure you know the truth about the things you have been taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod was king of the country of Judea, there was a Jewish religious leader named Zacharias. He worked for Abijah. His wife was of the family group of Aaron. Her name was Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were right with God and obeyed the Jewish Law and did what the Lord said to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had no children because Elizabeth was not able to have a child. Both of them were older people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacharias was doing his work as a religious leader for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders were given certain kinds of work to do. Zacharias was chosen to go to the house of God to burn special perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people stood outside praying during the time the special perfume was burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacharias saw an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar where the special perfume was burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw the angel, Zacharias was troubled and afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to him, “Zacharias, do not be afraid. Your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will give birth to a son. You are to name him John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be glad and have much joy. Many people will be happy because he is born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be great in the sight of the Lord and will never drink wine or any strong drink. Even from his birth, he will be filled with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of the Jews will be turned to the Lord their God by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be the one to go in the spirit and power of Elijah before Christ comes. He will turn the hearts of the fathers back to their children. He will teach those who do not obey to be right with God. He will get people ready for the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacharias said to the angel, “How can I know this for sure? I am old and my wife is old also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to him, “My name is Gabriel. I stand near God. He sent me to talk to you and bring to you this good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See! You will not be able to talk until the day this happens. It is because you did not believe my words. What I said will happen at the right time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people outside were waiting. They were surprised and wondered why Zacharias stayed so long in the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came out, he could not talk to them. They knew he had seen something special from God while he was in the house of God. He tried to talk to them with his hands but could say nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his days of working in the house of God were over, he went to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some time later Elizabeth knew she was to become a mother. She kept herself hidden for five months. She said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord has done for me. He has looked on me and has taken away my shame from among men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six months after Elizabeth knew she was to become a mother, Gabriel was sent from God to Nazareth. Nazareth was a town in the country of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to a woman who had never had a man. Her name was Mary. She was promised in marriage to a man named Joseph. Joseph was of the family of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel came to her and said, “You are honored very much. You are a favored woman. The Lord is with you. You are chosen from among many women.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she saw the angel, she was troubled at his words. She thought about what had been said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to her, “Mary, do not be afraid. You have found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: See! You are to become a mother and have a Son. You are to give Him the name Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be great. He will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give Him the place where His early father David sat.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He will be King over the family of Jacob forever and His nation will have no end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary said to the angel, “How will this happen? I have never had a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to her, “The Holy Spirit will come on you. The power of the Most High will cover you. The holy Child you give birth to will be called the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “See, your cousin Elizabeth, as old as she is, is going to give birth to a child. She was not able to have children before, but now she is in her sixth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God can do all things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary said, “I am willing to be used of the Lord. Let it happen to me as you have said.” Then the angel went away from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once Mary went from there to a town in the hill country of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went to the house of Zacharias to see Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Elizabeth heard Mary speak, the baby moved in her body. At the same time Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elizabeth spoke in a loud voice, “You are honored among women! Your Child is honored!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why has this happened to me? Why has the mother of my Lord come to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as I heard your voice, the baby in my body moved for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are happy because you believed. Everything will happen as the Lord told you it would happen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary said, “My heart sings with thanks for my Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my spirit is happy in God, the One Who saves from the punishment of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has looked on me, His servant-girl and one who is not important. But from now on all people will honor me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He Who is powerful has done great things for me. His name is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The loving-kindness of the Lord is given to the people of all times who honor Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has done powerful works with His arm. He has divided from each other those who have pride in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has taken rulers down from their thrones. He has put those who are in a place that is not important to a place that is important.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has filled those who are hungry with good things. He has sent the rich people away with nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has helped Israel His servant. This was done to remember His loving-kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He promised He would do this to our early fathers and to Abraham and to his family forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months. Then she went to her own home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time came, Elizabeth gave birth to a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her neighbors and family heard how the Lord had shown loving-kindness to her. They were happy for her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day they did the religious act of the Jews on the child. They named him Zacharias, after his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his mother said, “No! His name is John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to her, “No one in your family has that name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they talked to his father with their hands to find out what he would name the child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked for something to write on. He wrote, “His name is John.” They were all surprised and wondered about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacharias was able to talk from that time on and he gave thanks to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who lived near them were afraid. The news of what had happened was told through all the hill country of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard those words remembered them and said, “What is this child going to be?” For the hand of the Lord was on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacharias, the father of John, was filled with the Holy Spirit. He told what was going to happen, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let us thank the Lord God of Israel. He has bought His people and made them free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has raised up from the family of David One Who saves people from the punishment of their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His holy early preachers told us this long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God told us that we should be saved from those who hate us and from all those who work against us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would show loving-kindness to our early fathers. He would remember His holy promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God promised this to our early father Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He promised that we would be saved from those who hate us and that we might worship Him without being afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We can be holy and right with God all the days of our life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, my son, will be the one who speaks for the Most High. For you will go before the Lord to make the way ready for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will tell His people how to be saved from the punishment of sin by being forgiven of their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the heart of our God is full of loving-kindness for us, a light from heaven will shine on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will give light to those who live in darkness and are under the shadow of death. It will lead our feet in the way of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child grew and became strong in spirit. He lived in a desert until the day he started to preach to the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Caesar Augustus sent out word that the name of every person in the Roman nation must be written in the books of the nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This first writing took place while Quirinius was ruler of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the people went to their own cities to have their names written in the books of the nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph went up from the town of Nazareth in the country of Galilee to the town of Bethlehem. It was known as the city of David. He went there because he was from the family of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph went to have his and Mary’s names written in the books of the nation. Mary was his promised wife and soon to become a mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were there in Bethlehem, the time came for Mary to give birth to her baby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her first son was born. She put cloth around Him and laid Him in a place where cattle are fed. There was no room for them in the place where people stay for the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same country there were shepherds in the fields. They were watching their flocks of sheep at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord came to them. The shining-greatness of the Lord shone around them. They were very much afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to them, “Do not be afraid. See! I bring you good news of great joy which is for all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today, One Who saves from the punishment of sin has been born in the city of David. He is Christ the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be something special for you to see. This is the way you will know Him. You will find the Baby with cloth around Him, lying in a place where cattle are fed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once many angels from heaven were seen, along with the angel, giving thanks to God. They were saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Greatness and honor to our God in the highest heaven and peace on earth among men who please Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angels went from the shepherds back to heaven. The shepherds said to each other, “Let us go now to Bethlehem and see what has happened. The Lord has told us about this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went fast and found Mary and Joseph. They found the Baby lying in a place where cattle are fed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the Child, they told what the angel said about Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who heard it were surprised at what the shepherds told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary hid all these words in her heart. She thought about them much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The shepherds went back full of joy. They thanked God for all they had heard and seen. It happened as the angel had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When eight days were over, they did the religious act of becoming a Jew on the Child. He was named Jesus. This name was given to Him by the angel when Mary was told He was to be born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days were over for her to be made pure as it was written in the Law of Moses, they took Jesus to Jerusalem to give Him to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is written in the Law of the Lord, “The first-born male born of a woman will be called holy to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were to give a gift of two turtle-doves or two young birds on the altar in worship to the Lord. This was written in the Law of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man in Jerusalem by the name of Simeon. He was a good man and very religious. He was looking for the time when the Jewish nation would be saved. The Holy Spirit was on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Holy Spirit made it known to Simeon that he would not die before he had seen God’s Chosen One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to the house of God being led by the Holy Spirit. The parents took Jesus to the house of God. They came to do what the Law said must be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simeon took Jesus in his arms. He gave honor to Him and thanked God, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, now let me die in peace, as You have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes have seen the One Who will save men from the punishment of their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have made Him ready in the sight of all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be a light to shine on the people who are not Jews. He will be the shining-greatness of Your people the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph and the mother of Jesus were surprised and wondered about these words which were said about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon honored them and said to Mary the mother of Jesus, “See! This Child will make many people fall and many people rise in the Jewish nation. He will be spoken against.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sword will cut through your soul. By this the thoughts of many hearts will be understood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anna was a woman who spoke God’s Word. She was the daughter of Phanuel of the family group of Asher. Anna was many years old. She had lived with her husband seven years after she was married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her husband had died and she had lived without a husband eighty-four years. Yet she did not go away from the house of God. She served God day and night, praying and going without food so she could pray better.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time she came and gave thanks to God. She told the people in Jerusalem about Jesus. They were looking for the One to save them from the punishment of their sins and to set them free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joseph and Mary had done everything the Law said to do, they went back to Nazareth in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Child grew and became strong in spirit. He was filled with wisdom and the loving-favor of God was on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents went to Jerusalem every year for the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem as they had done before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of the special supper were over, they started back to their town. But the boy Jesus was still in Jerusalem. His parents did not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They thought Jesus was with the others of the group. They walked for one day. Then they looked for Him among their family and friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they could not find Jesus, they turned back to Jerusalem to look for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three days later they found Him in the house of God. He was sitting among the teachers. He was hearing what they said and asking questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who heard Him were surprised and wondered about His understanding and at what He said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When His parents saw Him, they were surprised. His mother said to Him, “My Son, why have You done this to us? See! Your father and I have had much sorrow looking for You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why were you looking for Me? Do you not know that I must be in My Father’s house?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They did not understand the things He said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went with them to Nazareth and obeyed them. But His mother kept all these words in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus grew strong in mind and body. He grew in favor with God and men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tiberius Caesar had been ruler for fifteen years. Pontius Pilate was ruler of the country of Judea. Herod was the ruler of the country of Galilee. His brother Philip was the ruler of the countries of Ituraea and Trachonitis. Lysanias was the ruler of the country of Abilene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Annas and Caiaphas were the head religious leaders.
The Word of God came to John the Baptist, the son of Zacharias. John was in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into all the country around the Jordan River. He preached that people should be baptized because they were sorry for their sins and had turned from them, and they would be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The early preacher Isaiah wrote these words: “His voice calls out in the desert. ‘Make the way ready for the Lord. Make the road straight for Him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every valley will be filled and every mountain and hill will be brought down. The turns in the road will be made straight and the rough places will be made smooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all men will see God saving people from the punishment of their sins.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said to the people who came to be baptized by him, “You family of snakes! Who told you how to keep from the anger of God that is coming?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do something to let me see that you have turned from your sins. Do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ I tell you, God can make children for Abraham out of these stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now the ax is on the root of the trees. Every tree that does not give good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people asked him, “Then what should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “If you have two coats, give one to him who has none. If you have food, you must share some.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tax-gatherers came to be baptized also. They asked him, “Teacher, what are we to do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do not take more money from people than you should.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also soldiers asked him, “What are we to do?” He answered them, “Take no money from anyone by using your own strength. Do not lie about anyone. Be happy with the pay you get.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were looking for something to happen. They were thinking in their hearts about John the Baptist. They wondered if he might be the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But John said to all of them, “I baptize you with water. There is One coming Who is greater than I. I am not good enough to get down and help Him take off His shoes. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He comes ready to clean the grain. He will gather the grain and clean it all. He will put the clean grain into a building. But He will burn that which is no good with a fire that cannot be put out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John spoke much more as he preached the Good News to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had also spoken sharp words to Herod the ruler because of Herodias. She was his brother Philip’s wife. And John spoke to Herod about all the wrongs he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To all these, Herod added another sin by putting John in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized also. As He prayed, the heaven opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Holy Spirit came down on Him in a body like a dove. A voice came from heaven and said, “You are My much-loved Son. I am very happy with You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was about thirty years old when He began His work. People thought Jesus was the son of Joseph, the son of Heli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heli was the son of Matthat. Matthat was the son of Levi. Levi was the son of Melchi. Melchi was the son of Jannai. Jannai was the son of Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph was the son of Mattathias. Mattathias was the son of Amos. Amos was the son of Nahum. Nahum was the son of Esli. Esli was the son of Naggai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Naggai was the son of Maath. Maath was the son of Mattathias. Mattathias was the son of Semein. Semein was the son of Josech. Josech was the son of Juda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Juda was the son of Johanan. Johanan was the son of Rhesa. Rhesa was the son of Zerubbabel. Zerubbabel was the son of Salathiel. Salathiel was the son of Neri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neri was the son of Melchi. Melchi was the son of Addi. Addi was the son of Cosam. Cosam was the son of Elmadam. Elmadam was the son of Er.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Er was the son of Joshua. Joshua was the son of Eliezer. Eliezer was the son of Jorim. Jorim was the son of Matthat. Matthat was the son of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levi was the son of Simeon. Simeon was the son of Judah. Judah was the son of Joseph. Joseph was the son of Janam. Janam was the son of Eliakim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliakim was the son of Melea. Melea was the son of Menna. Menna was the son of Mattatha. Mattatha was the son of Nathan. Nathan was the son of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was the son of Jesse. Jesse was the son of Obed. Obed was the son of Boaz. Boaz was the son of Salmon. Salmon was the son of Nahshon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nahshon was the son of Amminadab. Amminadab was the son of Admin. Admin was the son of Ram. Ram was the son of Hezron. Hezron was the son of Perez. Perez was the son of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah was the son of Jacob. Jacob was the son of Isaac. Isaac was the son of Abraham. Abraham was the son of Terah. Terah was the son of Nahor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nahor was the son of Serug. Serug was the son of Ragau. Ragau was the son of Peleg. Peleg was the son of Eber. Eber was the son of Shelah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shelah was the son of Cainan. Cainan was the son of Arphaxad. Arphaxad was the son of Shem. Shem was the son of Noah. Noah was the son of Lamech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lamech was the son of Methuselah. Methuselah was the son of Enoch. Enoch was the son of Jared. Jared was the son of Mahalaleel. Mahaleel was the son of Cainan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cainan was the son of Enos. Enos was the son of Seth. Seth was the son of Adam. Adam was the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was full of the Holy Spirit when He returned from the Jordan River. Then He was led by the Holy Spirit to a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was tempted by the devil for forty days and He ate nothing during that time. After that He was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, tell this stone to be made into bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “It is written, ‘Man is not to live by bread alone.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The devil took Jesus up on a high mountain. He had Jesus look at all the nations of the world at one time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to Jesus, “I will give You all this power and greatness. It has been given to me. I can give it to anyone I want to.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If You will worship me, all this will be Yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the devil, “Get behind Me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You must worship the Lord your God. You must obey Him only.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took Jesus up to Jerusalem. He had Jesus stand on the highest part of the house of God. The devil said to Jesus, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written, ‘He has told His angels to care for You and to keep You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their hands they will hold You up. Then Your foot will not hit against a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the devil, “It is written, ‘You must not tempt the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the devil finished tempting Jesus in every way, he went away from Jesus for awhile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went back to Galilee in the power of the Holy Spirit. People talked about Him so much that He was well-known through all the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus taught in their places of worship and was honored by all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came to Nazareth where He had grown up. As He had done before, He went into the Jewish place of worship on the Day of Rest. Then He stood up to read.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone handed Him the book of the early preacher Isaiah. He opened it and found the place where it was written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Spirit of the Lord is on Me. He has put His hand on Me to preach the Good News to poor people. He has sent Me to heal those with a sad heart. He has sent Me to tell those who are being held that they can go free. He has sent Me to make the blind to see and to free those who are held because of trouble.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He sent Me to tell of the time when men can receive favor with the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus closed the book. Then He gave it back to the leader and sat down. All those in the Jewish place of worship kept their eyes on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He began to say to them, “The Holy Writings you have just heard have been completed today.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They all spoke well of Jesus and agreed with the words He spoke. They said, “Is not this the son of Joseph?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I wonder if you will tell this old saying to Me, ‘Doctor, heal Yourself. What You did in the city of Capernaum, do in Your own country!’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He said, “A man who speaks for God is not respected in his own country.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is true that there were many women whose husbands had died in the Jewish land when Elijah lived. For three and a half years there was no rain and there was very little food in the land.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Elijah was sent to none of them, but he was sent to a woman in the city of Zarephath in the land of Sidon. This woman’s husband had died.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: There were many people in the Jewish land who had a bad skin disease when the early preacher Elisha lived. None of them was healed. But Naaman from the country of Syria was healed.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All those in the Jewish place of worship were angry when they heard His words.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They got up and took Jesus out of town to the top of a high hill. They wanted to throw Him over the side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus got away from among them and went on His way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went down to Capernaum in Galilee. He taught them on the Days of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were surprised and wondered about His teaching. His words had power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man in the Jewish place of worship had a demon. He cried with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do You want of us, Jesus of Nazareth? I know Who You are. You are the Holy One of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus spoke sharp words to the demon and said, “Do not talk! Come out of him!” When the demon had thrown the man down, he came out without hurting the man.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The people were all surprised. They asked each other, “What kind of word is this? He speaks to the demons with power and they come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about Jesus went through all the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went away from the Jewish place of worship and went into Simon’s house. Simon’s mother-in-law was in bed, very sick. They asked Jesus to help her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stood by her and told the disease to leave. It went from her. At once she got up and cared for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the sun went down, the people took all that were sick with many kinds of diseases to Jesus. He put His hands on all of them and they were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also demons came out of many people. The demons cried out and said, “You are Christ, the Son of God.” Jesus spoke strong words to them and would not let them speak. They knew He was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In the morning He went out to a desert. The people looked for Him. When they found Him, they were trying to keep Him from going away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I must preach about the holy nation of God in other cities also. This is why I was sent.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And He kept on preaching in the Jewish places of worship in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was standing by the lake of Gennesaret, many people pushed to get near Him. They wanted to hear the Word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw two boats on the shore. The fishermen were not there because they were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got into a boat which belonged to Simon. Jesus asked him to push it out a little way from land. Then He sat down and taught the people from the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had finished speaking, He said to Simon, “Push out into the deep water. Let down your nets for some fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon said to Him, “Teacher, we have worked all night and we have caught nothing. But because You told me to, I will let the net down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had done this, they caught so many fish, their net started to break.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They called to their friends working in the other boat to come and help them. They came and both boats were so full of fish they began to sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Simon Peter saw it, he got down at the feet of Jesus. He said, “Go away from me, Lord, because I am a sinful man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He and all those with him were surprised and wondered about the many fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, were surprised also. They were working together with Simon. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid. From now on you will fish for men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to land with their boats, they left everything and followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came to Him with a bad skin disease over all his body. When he saw Jesus, he got down on his face before Him. He begged Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can heal me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus put His hand on him and said, “I will, be healed.” At once the disease went away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told him to tell no one. He said, “Go and let the religious leader of the Jews see you. Give the gift on the altar in worship that Moses told you to give when a man is healed of a disease. This will show the leaders you have been healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about Jesus went out all the more. Many people came to hear Him and to be healed of their diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He went away by Himself to pray in a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On one of the days while Jesus was teaching, some proud religious law-keepers and teachers of the Law were sitting by Him. They had come from every town in the countries of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was there to heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men took a man who was not able to move his body to Jesus. He was carried on a bed. They looked for a way to take the man into the house where Jesus was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they could not find a way to take him in because of so many people. They made a hole in the roof over where Jesus stood. Then they let the bed with the sick man on it down before Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the man, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers thought to themselves, “Who is this Man Who speaks as if He is God? Who can forgive sins but God only?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said to them, “Why do you think this way in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or, ‘Get up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So that you may know the Son of Man has the right and the power on earth to forgive sins,” He said to the man who could not move his body, “I say to you, get up. Take your bed and go to your home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the sick man got up in front of them. He took his bed and went to his home thanking God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who were there were surprised and gave thanks to God, saying, “We have seen very special things today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jesus went out and saw a man who gathered taxes. His name was Levi (Matthew). Levi was sitting at his work. Jesus said to him, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levi got up, left everything and followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levi made a big supper for Jesus in his house. Many men who gathered taxes and other people sat down with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers talked against the followers of Jesus. They said, “Why do You eat and drink with men who gather taxes and with sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “People who are well do not need a doctor. Only those who are sick need a doctor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not come to call good people. I have come to call sinners to be sorry for their sins and to turn from them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked Jesus, “Why do the followers of John and of the proud religious law-keepers go without food so they can pray better, but Your followers keep on eating and drinking?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Can the friends at a wedding be sorry when the man just married is with them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The days will come when the man just married will be taken from them. Then they will not eat food so they can pray better in those days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them a picture-story. He said, “No one sews a piece of cloth from a new coat on an old coat. If he does, the new coat will have a hole. The new piece and the old coat will not be the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man puts new wine into old skin bags. If they did, the skins would break and the wine would run out. The bags would be no good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: New wine must be put into new bags and both are kept safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one wants new wine after drinking old wine. He says, ‘The old wine is better.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next Day of Rest Jesus was walking through the grain-fields. His followers picked grain. They rubbed it in their hands and ate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the proud religious law-keepers said to them, “Why are you doing what the Law says should not be done on the Day of Rest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Have you not read what David did when he and his men were hungry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into the house of God and ate the special bread used in the religious worship. He gave some to those who were with him also. The Law says only the religious leaders may eat that bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is Lord of the Day of Rest also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On another Day of Rest Jesus went into the Jewish place of worship and taught. A man with a dried-up hand was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers watched to see if He would heal on the Day of Rest. They wanted to have something to say against Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said to the man with the dried-up hand, “Stand up and come here.” The man stood up and went to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing. Does the Law say to do good on the Day of Rest or to do bad? To save life or to kill?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked around at them all and said to the man, “Put out your hand.” He put it out and his hand was healed. It was as good as his other hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers were filled with anger. They talked with each other about what they might do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Jesus went up on a mountain to pray. He prayed all night to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning He called His followers to Him. He chose twelve of them and called them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were Simon, whom He also named Peter, and his brother Andrew. There were James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Matthew and Thomas. There were James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon the Canaanite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were Judas, who was the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot who would hand Jesus over to be killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came down and stood on a plain with many of His followers. Many people came from the country of Judea and from Jerusalem and from the cities of Tyre and Sidon. They came to hear Him and to be healed of their diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were troubled with demons came and were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people tried to put their hands on Jesus. Power came from Him and He healed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked at His followers and said, “Those of you who are poor are happy, because the holy nation of God is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those of you who are hungry now are happy, because you will be filled. Those of you who have sorrow now are happy, because you will laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are happy when men hate you and do not want you around and put shame on you because you trust in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be glad in that day. Be full of joy for your reward is much in heaven. Their fathers did these things to the early preachers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is bad for you who are rich. You are receiving all that you will get.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is bad for you who are full. You will be hungry. It is bad for you who laugh now. You will have sorrow and you will cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is bad for you when everyone speaks well of you. In the same way, their fathers spoke well of the false teachers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I say to you who hear Me, love those who work against you. Do good to those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Respect and give thanks for those who try to bring bad to you. Pray for those who make it very hard for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever hits you on one side of the face, turn so he can hit the other side also. Whoever takes your coat, give him your shirt also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to any person who asks you for something. If a person takes something from you, do not ask for it back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do for other people what you would like to have them do for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love those who love you, what pay can you expect from that? Sinners also love those who love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do good to those who do good to you, what pay can you expect from that? Sinners also do good to those who do good to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you let people use your things and expect to get something back, what pay can you expect from that? Even sinners let sinners use things and they expect to get something back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But love those who hate you. Do good to them. Let them use your things and do not expect something back. Your reward will be much. You will be the children of the Most High. He is kind to those who are not thankful and to those who are full of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must have loving-kindness just as your Father has loving-kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not say what is wrong in other people’s lives. Then other people will not say what is wrong in your life. Do not say someone is guilty. Then other people will not say you are guilty. Forgive other people and other people will forgive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give, and it will be given to you. You will have more than enough. It can be pushed down and shaken together and it will still run over as it is given to you. The way you give to others is the way you will receive in return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus used a picture-story as He spoke to them. He said, “Can one blind man lead another blind man? Will they not fall into the ditch together?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The follower is not more important than his teacher. But everyone who learns well will be like his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you look at the small piece of wood in your brother’s eye and do not see the big piece of wood in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take that small piece of wood out of your eye,’ when you do not see the big piece of wood in your own eye? You pretend to be someone you are not. First, take the big piece of wood out of your own eye. Then you can see better to take the small piece of wood out of your brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A good tree cannot have bad fruit. A bad tree cannot have good fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every tree is known by its own fruit. Men do not gather figs from thorns. They do not gather grapes from thistles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Good comes from a good man because of the riches he has in his heart. Sin comes from a sinful man because of the sin he has in his heart. The mouth speaks of what the heart is full of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And why do you call Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ but do not do what I say?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever comes to Me and hears and does what I say, I will show you who he is like.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is like a man who built a house. He dug deep to put the building on rock. When the water came up and the river beat against the house, the building could not be shaken because it was built on rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who hears and does not do what I say, is like a man who built a house on nothing but earth. The water beat against the house. At once it fell and was destroyed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished teaching the people, He went back to Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A captain of the army had a servant whom he thought much of. This servant was very sick and was about to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the captain heard of Jesus, he sent some Jewish leaders to Him. They were to ask if He would come and heal this servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jesus and begged Him, saying, “The man is respected and should have this done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He loves our nation and has built our Jewish place of worship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went with them. When He was not far from the house, the captain told some friends to tell this to Jesus, “Lord, do not take the time to come to my house, because I am not good enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I am not good enough to come to You. But just say the word and my servant will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am a man who works for someone else also, and I have soldiers who work for me. I say to this man, ‘Go!’ and he goes. I say to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes. I say to my workman, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was surprised when He heard this. He turned to the people following Him and said, “I tell you, I have not found so much faith even in the Jewish nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had been sent went back to the captain’s house and found the servant well again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day Jesus went to a city called Nain. His followers and many other people went with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came near the city gate, a dead man was being carried out. He was the only son of a woman whose husband had died. Many people of the city were with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord saw her, He had loving-pity for her and said, “Do not cry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went and put His hand on the box in which the dead man was carried. The men who were carrying it, stopped. Jesus said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who was dead sat up and began to talk. Then Jesus gave him to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was afraid and they gave thanks to God. They said, “A great Man Who speaks for God has come among us! God has cared for His people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about Jesus went through all the country of Judea and over all the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers of John the Baptist told him about all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John called two of his followers and sent them to Jesus to ask, “Are You the One Who is to come? Or are we to look for another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men came to Jesus and said, “John the Baptist sent us to ask You, ‘Are You the One Who is to come? Or are we to look for another?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus was healing many people of all kinds of sickness and disease and was putting out demons. Many that were blind were able to see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to John’s followers, “Go back to John the Baptist and tell him what you have seen and heard. Tell him the blind are made to see. Those who could not walk, are walking. Those with a bad skin disease are healed. Those who could not hear, are hearing. The dead are raised to life and poor people have the Good News preached to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who is not ashamed of Me and does not turn away from Me is happy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As John’s followers were going away, Jesus began to tell the people about John the Baptist. He said, “Why did you go out to the desert? Did you go out to see a small tree moving in the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What did you go out to see? A man dressed in good clothes? Those who are dressed in good clothes are in the houses of kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go to see? One who speaks for God? Yes, I tell you, he is more than one who speaks for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the man the Holy Writings spoke of when they said, ‘See! I will send My helper to carry news ahead of You. He will make Your way ready for You!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, of those born of women, there is no one greater than John the Baptist. The least in the holy nation of God is greater than he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people who heard Jesus and those who gathered taxes showed they knew God was right and were baptized by John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the proud religious law-keepers and the men who knew the Law would not listen. They would not be baptized by John and they did not receive what God had for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “What are the people of this day like?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are like children playing in front of stores. They call to their friends, ‘We have played music for you, but you did not dance. We have had sorrow for you, but you did not have sorrow.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John the Baptist did not come eating bread or drinking wine and you say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking and you say, ‘See! He likes food and wine. He is a friend of men who gather taxes and of sinners!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wisdom is shown to be right by those who are wise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the proud religious law-keepers wanted Jesus to eat with him. Jesus went to his house and sat down to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a woman in the city who was a sinner. She knew Jesus was eating in the house of the proud religious law-keeper. She brought a jar of special perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she stood behind Him by His feet and cried. Her tears wet His feet and she dried them with her hair. She kissed His feet and put the special perfume on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keeper who had asked Jesus to eat with him saw this. He said to himself, “If this Man were One Who speaks for God, He would know who and what kind of a woman put her hands on Him. She is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I have something to say to you, Simon.” And Simon said, “Teacher, say it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There were two men who owed a certain man some money. The one man owed 500 pieces of silver money. The other man owed 50 pieces of silver money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither one of them had any money, so he told them they did not have to pay him back. Tell Me, which one would love him the most?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon said, “I think it would be the one who owed the most.” And Jesus said to him, “You have said the right thing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He turned to the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I came into your house and you gave Me no water to wash My feet. She washed My feet with her tears and dried them with the hairs of her head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You gave me no kiss, but this woman has kissed my feet from the time I came in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not put even oil on My head but this woman has put special perfume on My feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, her many sins are forgiven because she loves much. But the one who has been forgiven little, loves little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to the woman, “Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were eating with Him began to say to themselves, “Who is this Man Who even forgives sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you from the punishment of sin. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jesus went to all the cities and towns preaching and telling the Good News about the holy nation of God. The twelve followers were with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some women who had been healed of demons and diseases were with Him. Mary Magdalene, who had had seven demons put out of her, was one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joanna, the wife of Chuza who was one of Herod’s helpers, was another one. Susanna and many others also cared for Jesus by using what they had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people came together from every town to Jesus. He told them a picture-story.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A man went out to plant seed. As he planted the seed, some fell by the side of the road. It was walked on and birds came and ate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seed fell between rocks. As soon as it started to grow, it dried up because it had no water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seed fell among thorns. The thorns grew and did not give the seed room to grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some seed fell on good ground. It grew and gave one hundred times as much grain.” When Jesus had finished saying this, He cried out, “You have ears, then listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His followers asked Him what this picture-story meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “You were given the secrets about the holy nation of God. Others are told picture-stories. As they look, they do not see. As they hear, they do not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the picture-story means. The seed is the Word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those by the side of the road hear the Word. Then the devil comes and takes the Word from their hearts. He does not want them to believe and be saved from the punishment of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those which fell among rocks are those who when they hear the Word receive it with joy. These have no root. For awhile they believe, but when they are tempted they give up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those which fell among thorns hear the Word but go their own way. The cares of this life let the thorns grow. A love for money lets the thorns grow also. And the fun of this life lets the thorns grow. Their grain never becomes full-grown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those which fell on good ground have heard the Word. They keep it in a good and true heart and they keep on giving good grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No man lights a lamp and puts it under a pail or under a bed. He puts it on a lamp-stand so all who come into the room may see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing is secret but what will be known. Anything that is hidden will be brought into the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful how you listen! Whoever has, to him will be given. Whoever does not have, even the little he has will be taken from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mother of Jesus and His brothers came to Him. They could not get near Him because of so many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone said to Jesus, “Your mother and brothers are standing outside. They want to see You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “My mother and brothers are these who hear the Word of God and do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On one of those days Jesus and His followers got into a boat. Jesus said to them, “Let us go over to the other side of the lake.” Then they pushed out into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were going, Jesus fell asleep. A wind storm came over the lake. The boat was filling with water and they were in danger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers came to awake Jesus. They said, “Teacher! Teacher! We are going to die!” Then Jesus got up and spoke sharp words to the wind and the high waves. The wind stopped blowing and there were no more waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Where is your faith?” The followers were surprised and afraid. They said to each other, “What kind of a man is He? He speaks to the wind and the waves and they obey Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to the land of the Gadarenes, which is on the other side of the country of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus stepped out on land, a man met Him who had come from the city. This man had demons in him. For a long time he had worn no clothes. He did not live in a house, but lived among the graves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus, he got down before Him and cried with a loud voice, “What do You want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High? I beg of You not to hurt me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus had spoken to the demon to come out of the man. Many times the demon had taken hold of him. The man had to be tied with chains. But he would break the chains and be taken by the demon into the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” And the demon answered, “Many,” because many demons had gone into him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons asked Jesus not to send them to the hole without a bottom in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were many pigs feeding on the side of the mountain. The demons begged Jesus to let them go into the pigs. Jesus said they could.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons came out of the man and went into the pigs. Then the many pigs ran down the side of the mountain into the water and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who cared for the pigs ran fast and told what had happened in the town and in the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People came to see what had happened. They came to Jesus and saw the man from whom the demons had been sent. He was sitting at the feet of Jesus with clothes on and had the right use of his mind. The people were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had seen it told how the man who had had the demons was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people of the country of the Gadarenes begged Jesus to go away from them. They were very much afraid. Jesus got into the boat and went back to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man out of whom the demons had gone begged to go with Jesus. But Jesus sent him away and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go back to your house and tell everything God has done for you.” He went back and told all the people of the city what great things Jesus had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people were glad to see Jesus when He got back. They were waiting for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Jairus was a leader of the Jewish place of worship. As he came to Jesus, he got down at His feet. He asked Jesus if He would come to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had only one daughter and she was dying. This girl was about twelve years old. As Jesus went, the people pushed Him from every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman had been sick for twelve years with a flow of blood. (She had spent all the money she had on doctors.) But she could not be healed by anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came behind Jesus and touched the bottom of His coat. At once the flow of blood stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Who touched Me?” Everyone said that they had not touched Him. Peter said, “Teacher, so many people are pushing You from every side and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Someone touched Me because I know power has gone from Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw she could not hide it, she came shaking. She got down before Jesus. Then she told Jesus in front of all the people why she had touched Him. She told how she was healed at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was yet talking, a man came from the house of the leader of the place of worship. This man said to Jairus, “Your daughter is dead. Do not make the Teacher use anymore of His time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard it and said to Jairus, “Do not be afraid, only believe. She will be made well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went into the house. He let only Peter and James and John and the father and mother of the girl go in with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was crying and full of sorrow because of her. Jesus said, “Do not cry. She is not dead, but is sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they laughed at Jesus because they knew she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent them all out. He took the girl by the hand and said, “Child, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her spirit came back and she got up at once. Jesus told them to bring her food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her parents were surprised and wondered about it. Then Jesus told them they should tell no one what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called His twelve followers to Him. He gave them the right and the power over all demons and to heal diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent them to preach about the holy nation of God and to heal the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “Take nothing along for the trip. Do not take a walking stick or a bag or bread or money. Do not take two coats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever house you go into, stay there until you are ready to go on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone will not take you in, as you leave that city, shake its dust off your feet. That will speak against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out, going from town to town. They preached the Good News and healed the sick everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod the leader heard of all that had been done by Jesus. He was troubled because some people said that John the Baptist had been raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people said that Elijah had come back. Others thought one of the early preachers had been raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod said, “I had John’s head cut off. But who is this Man that I hear these things about?” He wanted to see Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelve followers came back. They told Jesus what they had done. Jesus took them to a desert near the town of Bethsaida. There they could be alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people knew where Jesus was, they followed Him. Jesus was happy to see them and talked to them about the holy nation of God. He healed all who were sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day was about over, the twelve followers came to Jesus. They said, “Send these many people away so they can go to the towns and country near here. There they can find a place to sleep and get food. We are here in a desert.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “Give them something to eat.” They said, “We have only five loaves of bread and two fish. Are we to go and buy food for all these people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were about five thousand men. Jesus said to His followers, “Have them sit down in groups of fifty people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did as He told them. They made all of the people sit down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus took the five loaves of bread and two fish, He looked up to heaven and gave thanks. He broke them in pieces and gave them to His followers to give to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were filled. They picked up twelve baskets full of pieces of bread and fish after the people finished eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was praying alone, His followers were with Him. Jesus asked them, “Who do people say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “John the Baptist, but some say Elijah. Others say that one of the early preachers has been raised from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter said, “You are the Christ of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke to them and told them to tell no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The Son of Man must suffer many things. The leaders and the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law will have nothing to do with Him. He must be killed and be raised from the dead three days later.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them all, “If anyone wants to follow Me, he must give up himself and his own desires. He must take up his cross everyday and follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wants to keep his own life safe, he must lose it. If anyone gives up his life because of Me, he will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what does a man have if he gets all the world and loses or gives up his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is ashamed of Me and My Words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when He comes in His own shining-greatness and of the Father’s and of the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, some standing here will not die until they see the holy nation of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About eight days after Jesus had said these things, He took Peter and James and John with Him. They went up on a mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus prayed, He was changed in looks before them. His clothes became white and shining bright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two men talked with Jesus. They were Moses and Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They looked like the shining-greatness of heaven as they talked about His death in Jerusalem which was soon to happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and those with him had gone to sleep. When they woke up, they saw His shining-greatness and the two men who stood with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the two men went from Jesus, Peter said to Him, “Teacher, it is good for us to be here. Let us build three tents to worship in. One will be for You. One will be for Moses. One will be for Elijah.” He did not know what he was saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was talking, a cloud came over them. They were afraid as the cloud came in around them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My Son, the One I have chosen. Listen to Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the voice was gone, Jesus was standing there alone. From that time on, they kept these things to themselves. They told no one what they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day they came down from the mountain and many people met Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man from among the people cried out, “Teacher, I beg of You to look at my son. He is my only child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, a demon takes him and makes him cry out. It takes hold of him and makes him shake. Spit runs from his mouth. He has marks on his body from being hurt. The demon does not want to go from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I begged Your followers to put the demon out, but they could not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “You people of this day do not have faith. You turn from what is right! How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring your son to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the boy was coming, the demon threw him down and made him lose the use of his mind for awhile. Jesus spoke sharp words to the demon. He healed the child and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all surprised at the great power of God. They all were thinking about the special things Jesus had done. And Jesus said to His followers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember these words. For the Son of Man will be given over into the hands of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not understand these words because it was hidden from them. They did not know what Jesus meant and were afraid to ask Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers argued among themselves about which of them would be the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew what they were thinking. He put a child beside Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the followers, “Whoever receives this child in My name, receives Me. Whoever receives Me, receives Him Who sent Me. The one who is least among you is the one who is great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said, “Teacher, we saw someone putting out demons in Your name. We told him to stop because he was not following us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Do not stop him. He who is not against us is for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was about time for Jesus to be taken up into heaven. He turned toward Jerusalem and was sure that nothing would stop Him from going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent men on ahead of Him. They came to a town in Samaria. There they got things ready for Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people did not want Him there because they knew He was on His way to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John, His followers, saw this. They said, “Lord, do You want us to speak so fire will come down from heaven and burn them up as Elijah did?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned and spoke sharp words to them. (He said, “You do not know what kind of spirit you have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man did not come to destroy men’s lives. He came to save them from the punishment of sin.” They went on their way to another town.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were going on their way, a man said to Jesus, “Lord, I will follow You wherever You go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes. Birds of the sky have nests. The Son of Man has no place to put His head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to another, “Follow Me.” But the man said, “Lord, let me go first and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Let the people who are dead bury their own dead. You go and preach about the holy nation of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another one said, “Lord, I will follow You, but first let me go and say good-bye to those at home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Anyone who puts his hand on a plow and looks back at the things behind is of no use in the holy nation of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this the Lord chose seventy others. He sent them out two together to every city and place where He would be going later.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “There is much grain ready to gather. But the workmen are few. Pray then to the Lord Who is the Owner of the grain-fields that He will send workmen to gather His grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go on your way. Listen! I send you out like lambs among wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take no money. Do not take a bag or shoes. Speak to no one along the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go into a house, say that you hope peace will come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man who loves peace lives there, your good wishes will come to him. If your good wishes are not received, they will come back to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay in the same house. Eat and drink what they give you. The workman should have his thanks. Do not move from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whenever a city receives you, eat the things that are put before you there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heal the sick. Say to them, ‘The holy nation of God is near.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever city does not receive you, go into its streets and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Even the dust of your city that is on our feet we are cleaning off against you. But understand this, the holy nation of God has come near you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, on the day men stand before God, it will be easier for the city of Sodom than for that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is bad for you, city of Chorazin! It is bad for you, town of Bethsaida! For if the powerful works which were done in you had been done in the cities of Tyre and Sidon they would have turned from their sins long ago. They would have shown their sorrow by putting on clothes made from hair and would have sat in ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be better for Tyre and Sidon on the day men stand before God and be told they are guilty than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, are you to be lifted up into heaven? You will be taken down to hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever listens to you, listens to Me. Whoever has nothing to do with you, has nothing to do with Me. Whoever has nothing to do with Me, has nothing to do with the One Who sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventy came back full of joy. They said, “Lord, even the demons obeyed us when we used Your name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I saw Satan fall from heaven like lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen! I have given you power to walk on snakes. I have given you power over small animals with a sting of poison. I have given you power over all the power of the one who works against you. Nothing will hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, you should not be happy because the demons obey you but be happy because your names are written in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this time Jesus was full of the joy of the Holy Spirit. He said, “I thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth. You have kept these things hidden from the wise and from those who have much learning. You have shown them to little children. Yes, Father, it was what you wanted done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everything has been given to Me by My Father. No one knows the Son but the Father. No one knows the Father but the Son and the Son makes the Father known to those He chooses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He turned to His followers and said without anyone else hearing, “Happy are those who see what you see!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, many early preachers and kings have wanted to see the things you are seeing, but they did not see them. They have wanted to hear the things you are hearing, but they did not hear them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
