verses.text: A man stood up who knew the Law and tried to trap Jesus. He said, “Teacher, what must I do to have life that lasts forever?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “What is written in the Law? What does the Law say?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man said, “You must love the Lord your God with all your heart. You must love Him with all your soul. You must love Him with all your strength. You must love Him with all your mind. You must love your neighbor as you love yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have said the right thing. Do this and you will have life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man tried to make himself look good. He asked Jesus, “Who is my neighbor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to the city of Jericho. Robbers came out after him. They took his clothes off and beat him. Then they went away, leaving him almost dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A religious leader was walking down that road and saw the man. But he went by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, a man from the family group of Levi was walking down that road. When he saw the man who was hurt, he came near to him but kept on going on the other side of the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a man from the country of Samaria came by. He went up to the man. As he saw him, he had loving-pity on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got down and put oil and wine on the places where he was hurt and put cloth around them. Then the man from Samaria put this man on his own donkey. He took him to a place where people stay for the night and cared for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day the man from Samaria was ready to leave. He gave the owner of that place two pieces of money to care for him. He said to him, ‘Take care of this man. If you use more than this, I will give it to you when I come again.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Which of these three do you think was a neighbor to the man who was beaten by the robbers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who knew the Law said, “The one who showed loving-pity on him.” Then Jesus said, “Go and do the same.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went on their way, they came to a town where a woman named Martha lived. She cared for Jesus in her home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha had a sister named Mary. Mary sat at the feet of Jesus and listened to all He said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha was working hard getting the supper ready. She came to Jesus and said, “Do You see that my sister is not helping me? Tell her to help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only a few things are important, even just one. Mary has chosen the good thing. It will not be taken away from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus had been praying. One of His followers said to Him, “Lord, teach us to pray as John the Baptist taught his followers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father in heaven, Your name is holy. May Your holy nation come. What You want done, may it be done on earth as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give us the bread we need everyday.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forgive us our sins, as we forgive those who sin against us. Do not let us be tempted.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “If one of you has a friend and goes to him in the night and says, ‘Friend, give me three loaves of bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a friend of mine is on a trip and has stopped at my house. I have no food to give him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man inside the house will say, ‘Do not trouble me. The door is shut. My children and I are in bed. I cannot get up and give you bread.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you, he may not get up and give him bread because he is a friend. Yet, if he keeps on asking, he will get up and give him as much as he needs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you, ask, and what you ask for will be given to you. Look, and what you are looking for you will find. Knock, and the door you are knocking on will be opened to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who asks, will receive what he asks for. Everyone who looks, will find what he is looking for. Everyone who knocks, will have the door opened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Would any of you fathers give your son a stone if he asked for bread? Or would you give a snake if he asked for a fish?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he asked for an egg, would you give him a small animal with a sting of poison?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are sinful and you know how to give good things to your children. How much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was putting a demon out of a man who could not speak. When the demon was gone, the man could speak. All the people were surprised and wondered about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them said, “He puts out demons through Satan, the king of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others tried to trap Jesus. They asked for something special to see from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He knew their thoughts and said to them, “Every nation divided into groups that fight each other will be destroyed. Every family divided into groups that fight each other will not stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Satan is divided against himself, how will his nation stand? And yet you say I put out demons through Satan!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I put out demons through Satan, by whose help do your sons put them out? Your own sons will say if you are guilty or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I put out demons by the power of God, then the holy nation of God has come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a strong man watches his house and is ready to fight, his things are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a stronger man comes along, he wins the fight. He takes away all the things to fight with that the man of the house had put his trust in. Then the stronger man takes anything he wants from the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is not with Me is against Me. Whoever does not gather with Me is sending them everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a demon is gone out of a man, it goes through dry places to find rest. If it finds none, it says, ‘I will go back to my house I came from.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the demon comes back, it finds the house cleaned and looking good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the demon goes out and comes back bringing seven demons worse than itself. They go in and live there. In the end that man is worse than at the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was talking, a woman of the group said with a loud voice, “The woman is happy who gave You birth and who fed You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said, “Yes, but those who hear the Word of God and obey it are happy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people were gathered near Jesus, He said, “The people of this day are sinful. They are looking for something special to see. They will get nothing special to see, except what Jonah the early preacher did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jonah was something special to the people of the city of Nineveh, the Son of Man will be to the people of this day also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen of the south will stand up on the day men stand before God. She will say the people of this day are guilty because she came from the ends of the earth to listen to the wise sayings of Solomon. And look, Someone greater than Solomon is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up on the day men stand before God. They will say the people of this day are guilty because the men of Nineveh were sorry for their sins and turned from them when Jonah preached. And look, Someone greater than Jonah is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No man lights a lamp and then hides it under a pail. He puts the light on a lamp-stand so those who come in can see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eye is the light of the body. When your eye is good, your whole body is full of light. When your eye is sinful, your whole body is full of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful that the light in you is not dark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your whole body is full of light, with no dark part, then it will shine. It will be as a lamp that gives light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was talking, a proud religious law-keeper asked Him to eat with him. Jesus went to the man’s house and took His place at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keeper was surprised and wondered why Jesus had not washed before He ate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, “You proud religious law-keepers make the outside of the cup and plate clean, but inside you are full of stealing and sinning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are foolish. Did not He that made the outside make the inside also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give yourself as a gift and then you will be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is bad for you, proud religious law-keepers! You give one-tenth part of your spices. But you give no thought to what is right and to the love of God. You should do both of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is bad for you, proud religious law-keepers! For you like to have the important seats in the places of worship. You like to have people speak good-sounding words to you as you are in the center of town where people gather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is bad for you, teachers of the Law and proud religious law-keepers and you who pretend to be someone you are not! For you are like graves that are hidden. Men walk on graves without knowing they are there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the men who knew the Law said to Jesus, “Teacher, You are making us look bad when You speak like this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “It is bad for you also, you men who know the Law! For you put heavy loads on the shoulders of men. But you will not even put your finger on one of these loads to help them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is bad for you! For you make beautiful buildings for the graves of the early preachers your fathers killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are saying what your fathers did was good, because they killed the early preachers and you are making their graves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For this reason the wisdom of God has said, ‘I will send them early preachers and missionaries. Some they will kill and some they will make it very hard for.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blood of all the early preachers from the beginning of the world is on the people of this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zacharias, the one who died between the altar and the house of God. For sure, I tell you, the people of this day will be guilty for this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is bad for you men who know the Law! For you have locked the door to the house of learning. You are not going in yourselves and you do not allow those to go in who are about to go in.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus went away from there, the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers were very angry and tried to make Him say many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They planned against Jesus and tried to trap Him with something He might say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time thousands of people gathered together. There were so many that they walked on each other. Jesus spoke to His twelve followers first, saying, “Look out! Have nothing to do with the yeast of the proud religious law-keepers which is pretending to be something it is not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is nothing covered up that will not be seen. There is nothing hidden that will not be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What you have said in the dark will be heard in the light. What you have said in a low voice in a closed room will be spoken with a loud voice from the top of houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I say to you, My friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body and then can do no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will tell you the one to be afraid of. Be afraid of Him Who has power to put you into hell after He has killed you. Yes, I say to you, be afraid of Him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Are not five small birds sold for two small pieces of money? God does not forget even one of the birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God knows how many hairs you have on your head. Do not be afraid. You are worth more than many small birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also, I tell you, everyone who makes Me known to men, the Son of Man will make him known to the angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever acts as if he does not know Me and does not make Me known to men, he will not be spoken of to the angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven. Whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they take you to the places of worship and to the courts and to the leaders of the country, do not be worried about what you should say or how to say it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Holy Spirit will tell you what you should say at that time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the people said to Jesus, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the riches that our father left us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Friend, who has told Me to say who should get what?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them all, “Watch yourselves! Keep from wanting all kinds of things you should not have. A man’s life is not made up of things, even if he has many riches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He told them a picture-story, saying, “The fields of a rich man gave much grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man thought to himself, ‘What will I do? I have no place to put the grain.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, ‘I know what I will do. I will take down my grain building and I will build a bigger one. I will put all my grain and other things I own into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have many good things put away in your building. It will be all you need for many years to come. Now rest and eat and drink and have lots of fun.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to him, ‘You fool! Tonight your soul will be taken from you. Then who will have all the things you have put away?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the same with a man who puts away riches for himself and does not have the riches of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to His followers, “Because of this, I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you are going to eat. Do not worry about your body, what you are going to wear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Life is worth more than food. The body is worth more than clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at the birds. They do not plant seeds. They do not gather grain. They have no grain buildings for keeping grain. Yet God feeds them. Are you not worth more than the birds?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Which of you can make yourself a little taller by worrying?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you cannot do that which is so little, why do you worry about other things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Think how the flowers grow. They do not work or make cloth. Yet, I tell you, that King Solomon in all his greatness was not dressed as well as one of these flowers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God puts these clothes on the grass of the field. The grass is in the field today and put into the fire tomorrow. How much more would He want to give you clothing? You have so little faith!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not give so much thought to what you will eat or drink. Do not be worried about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the nations of the world go after these things. Your Father knows you need these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, go after the holy nation of God. Then all these other things will be given to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be afraid, little flock. Your Father wants to give you the holy nation of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell what you have and give the money to poor people. Have money-bags for yourselves that will never wear out. These money-bags are riches in heaven that will always be there. No robber can take them and no bugs can eat them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your heart will be wherever your riches are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be ready and dressed. Have your lights burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be like men who are waiting for their owner to come home from a wedding supper. When he comes and knocks on the door, they will open it for him at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those servants are happy when their owner finds them watching when he comes. For sure, I tell you, he will be dressed and ready to care for them. He will have them seated at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The owner might come late at night or early in the morning. Those servants are happy if their owner finds them watching whenever he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But understand this, that if the owner of a house had known when the robber was coming, he would have been watching. He would not have allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must be ready also. The Son of Man is coming at a time when you do not think He will come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said, “Lord, are You telling this picture-story to us or to all the people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Who is the faithful and wise servant his owner made boss over the others? He is the one who is to have food ready at the right time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That servant is happy who is doing his work when the owner comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, he will make him boss over all he has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But what if that servant says to himself, ‘The owner will not be coming soon,’ and then beats the other servants and eats and drinks and gets drunk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The owner of that servant will come on a day and at an hour when he is not looking for him. He will cut him in pieces and will put him with those who do not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant who knew what the owner wanted done, but did not get ready for him, or did not do what he wanted done, will be beaten many times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the servant who did not know what his owner wanted done, but did things that would be reason to be beaten, will be beaten only a few times. The man who receives much will have to give much. If much is given to a man to take care of, men will expect to get more from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have come to bring fire down to the earth. I wish it were already started!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have a baptism to go through. How troubled I am until it is over!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you think I came to bring peace on the earth? I tell you, no! I came to divide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on there will be five in one house divided. Three will be against two and two will be against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The father will be against the son. The son will be against the father. The mother will be against the daughter. The daughter will be against the mother. The mother-in-law will be against the daughter-in-law. The daughter-in-law will be against the mother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus also said to the people, “When you see a cloud coming in the west, you say at once, ‘It is going to rain.’ And it does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you see the wind blow from the south, you say, ‘It will be a hot day.’ And it is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You who pretend to be someone you are not, you know all about the sky and the earth. But why do you not know what is happening these days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you not know for yourselves what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a person says you are wrong and takes you to court, try to make it right with him as you go, or he will take you to the head of the court. Then he will take you to the police and you will be put in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, you will not be let out of prison until you have paid the last piece of money of the fine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this time some people came to Jesus. They told Him that Pilate had killed some people from the country of Galilee. It was while they were giving gifts of animals on the altar in worship to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate put their blood together with the blood of the animals. Jesus said to them, “What about these people from Galilee? Were they worse sinners than all the other people from Galilee because they suffered these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I tell you. But unless you are sorry for your sins and turn from them, you too will all die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What about those eighteen men who were killed when the high building in Siloam fell on them? Do you think they were the worst sinners living in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I tell you. But unless you are sorry for your sins and turn from them, you too will all die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He told them this picture-story: “A man had a fig tree in his grape-field. He looked for fruit on it but found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to his servant, ‘See! For three years I have been coming here looking for fruit on this fig tree. I never find any. Cut it down. Why does it even waste the ground?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant said, ‘Sir! Leave it here one more year. I will dig around it and put plant food on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be that it will give fruit next year. If it does not, then cut it down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was teaching in one of the Jewish places of worship on the Day of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman was there who had suffered for eighteen years because of a demon. She was not able to stand up straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw her and said, “Woman, you are now free from your trouble!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He put His hand on her. At once she stood up straight and gave thanks to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader of the Jewish place of worship was angry because Jesus healed on the Day of Rest. The leader said to the people, “There are six days in which work should be done. Come on those days and get healed. Do not come to be healed on the Day of Rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “You pretend to be someone you are not! Do not each of you let his cow or his donkey out and lead them to water on the Day of Rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should not this Jewish woman be made free from this trouble on the Day of Rest? She has been chained by Satan for eighteen years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He said this, all those who were against Him were ashamed. All the many people were glad for the great things being done by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus asked, “What is the holy nation of God like? What can I use to show you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a mustard seed which a man took and planted in his field. It grew and became a tree. The birds of the sky stayed in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Jesus said, “What can I use to show you what the holy nation of God is like?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like yeast that a woman put into three pails of flour until it was all full of yeast.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus taught the people as He went through the cities and towns on His way to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone asked Jesus, “Lord, will only a few people be saved from the punishment of sin?” Jesus said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Work hard to go in through the narrow door. I tell you, many will try to go in but will not be able to go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The owner of the house will get up and shut the door. You who are on the outside will knock on the door and say, ‘Lord, let us in.’ Then He will say, ‘I do not know you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank with You when You taught in our streets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He will say, ‘I tell you, I do not know you. Go away from Me. You are sinful.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There will be loud crying and grinding of teeth when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the early preachers in the holy nation of God, but you will be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who sit at the table in the holy nation of God will come from the east and west and from the north and south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen! Some are last who will be first. Some are first who will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same day some of the proud religious law-keepers came to Jesus. They said, “Go away from here! Herod wants to kill You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘See. I put out demons and heal the sick. I will do these things today and tomorrow. And the third day My work will be finished.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I must go on My way today and tomorrow and the day after. One who speaks for God cannot die except at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you kill the early preachers and throw stones on those sent to you. How many times I wanted to gather your children around me, as a bird gathers her young under her wings, but you would not let Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See! Your house is empty. And I tell you, you will not see Me again until the time comes when you will say, ‘Great and honored is the One Who comes in the name of the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the Day of Rest Jesus went into the house of one of the leaders of the proud religious law-keepers to eat. They all watched Jesus to see what He would do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man who had very large arms and legs because of a sickness was put before Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers, “Does the Law say it is right to heal on the Day of Rest, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not answer. Jesus took hold of the man and healed him and sent him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the leaders, “If one of you had a cow or donkey that fell into a hole, would you not go at once and pull it out on the Day of Rest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were not able to answer His questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus had been watching those who were asked to come to supper. They were all trying to get the important seats. He told them a picture-story, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are asked by someone to a wedding supper, do not take the important seat. Someone more important than you may have been asked to come also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who asked both of you to come may say to you, ‘The important seat is for this man.’ Then you will be ashamed as you take the last place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you are asked to come to the table, sit down on the last seat. Then the one who asked you may come and say to you, ‘Friend, go to a more important place.’ Then you will be shown respect in front of all who are at the table with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever makes himself look more important than he is will find out how little he is worth. Whoever does not try to honor himself will be made important.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the man who asked Him to eat in his house, “When you have a supper, do not ask your friends or your brothers or your family or your rich neighbors. They will ask you to come to their place for a supper. That way you will be paid back for what you have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have a supper, ask poor people. Ask those who cannot walk and those who are blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be happy if you do this. They cannot pay you back. You will get your pay when the people who are right with God are raised from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one of those eating at the table with Jesus heard this, he said, “Everyone is happy who will eat in the holy nation of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the leader of the proud religious law-keepers, “There was a man who was giving a big supper. He asked many people to come to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was about time to eat, he sent one of the servants he owned to tell those he had asked, saying, ‘Come, everything is ready now.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all gave different reasons why they could not come. The first said, ‘I have bought some land and I must go and see it. Do not expect me to come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another one said, ‘I have bought ten cows to use for working in my fields. I must go and try them out. Do not expect me to come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another one said, ‘I have just been married and I cannot come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant went back to his owner and told him these things. Then his owner became angry. He said to his servant, ‘Hurry into the streets and narrow roads of the city and bring poor people here. Bring those whose bodies are diseased. Bring those who cannot walk and those who are blind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant came back and said, ‘Sir, what you told me to do has been done. But there are still some empty places.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the owner said to his servant, ‘Go out along the roads leading away from the city and into the fields. Tell them they must come. Do this so my house will be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, not one of those I had asked will eat of my supper.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people followed Jesus. Then He turned around and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If any man comes to Me and does not have much more love for Me than for his father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, and even his own life, he cannot be My follower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he does not carry his cross and follow Me, he cannot be My follower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If one of you wanted to build a large building, you would sit down first and think of how much money it would take to build it. You would see if you had enough money to finish it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or when the base of the building is finished, you might see that you do not have enough money to finish it. Then all who would see it would make fun of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would say, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What if a king is going to war with another king? Will he not sit down first and decide if he is able to go with 10,000 men against the other king who is coming with 20,000 men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or, he will send a soldier to the other king while he is still a long way off. He will ask what can be done to have peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, whoever does not give up all that he has, cannot be My follower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Salt is good. But if salt has lost its taste, how can it be made to taste like salt again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is no good for the field or the waste place. Men throw it away. You have ears, then listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the tax-gatherers and sinners were coming to hear Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers and the teachers of the Law began to speak against Him. They said, “This man receives sinners and eats with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them a picture-story, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What if one of you had one hundred sheep and you lost one of them? Would you not leave the ninety-nine in the country and go back and look for the one which was lost until you find it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you find it, you are happy as you carry it back on your shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you would go to your house and call your friends and neighbors. You would say to them, ‘Be happy with me because I have found my sheep that was lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven because of one sinner who is sorry for his sins and turns from them, than for ninety-nine people right with God who do not have sins to be sorry for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What if a woman has ten silver pieces of money and loses one of them? Does she not light a lamp and sweep the floor and look until she finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together. She says to them, ‘Be happy with me. I have found the piece of money I had lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, it is the same way among the angels of God. If one sinner is sorry for his sins and turns from them, the angels are very happy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, “There was a man who had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The younger son said to his father, ‘Father, let me have the part of the family riches that will be coming to me.’ Then the father divided all that he owned between his two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon after that the younger son took all that had been given to him and went to another country far away. There he spent all he had on wild and foolish living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all his money was spent, he was hungry. There was no food in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to work for a man in this far away country. His work was to feed pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was so hungry he was ready to eat the outside part of the ears of the corn the pigs ate because no one gave him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He began to think about what he had done. He said to himself, ‘My father pays many men who work for him. They have all the food they want and more than enough. I am about dead because I am so hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will get up and go to my father. I will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not good enough to be called your son. But may I be as one of the workmen you pay to work?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The son got up and went to his father. While he was yet a long way off, his father saw him. The father was full of loving-pity for him. He ran and threw his arms around him and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I am not good enough to be called your son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the father said to the workmen he owned, ‘Hurry! Get the best coat and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring the calf that is fat and kill it. Let us eat and be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my son was dead and now he is alive again. He was lost and now he is found. Let us eat and have a good time.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The older son was out in the field. As he was coming near the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called one of the servants and asked what was happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant answered, ‘Your brother has come back and your father has killed the fat calf. Your brother is in the house and is well.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The older brother was angry and would not go into the house. His father went outside and asked him to come in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The older son said to his father, ‘All these many years I have served you. I have always obeyed what you said. But you never gave me a young goat so I could have a supper and a good time with my friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as soon as this son of yours came back, you killed the fat calf. And yet he wasted your money with bad women.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The father said to him, ‘My son, you are with me all the time. All that I have is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is right and good that we should have a good time and be glad. Your brother was dead and now he is alive again. He was lost and now he is found.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to His followers, “There was a rich man who put a boss over his houses and lands. Someone told him that his boss was not using his riches in a right way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man sent for the boss and said, ‘What is this I hear about you? Tell me what you have done with my things. You are not to be the boss of my houses and lands anymore.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The boss said to himself, ‘What will I do now? The owner of the houses and lands is taking my work away from me. I cannot dig in the ground for a living. I am too proud to ask for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know what I will do. I will make it so that when I lose this work I will be able to go to the homes of my friends.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He sent for the people who owed the rich man. He asked the first one, ‘How much do you owe the owner?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first man said, ‘One hundred barrels of oil.’ The boss said to him, ‘Take your bill. Sit down at once and change it to fifty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked another one, ‘How much do you owe?’ He said, ‘One hundred bags of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill and change it to eighty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the rich man said that this sinful boss had been wise to plan for himself for the days ahead. For the people of the world are wiser in their day than the children of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, make friends for yourselves by using the riches of the world that are so often used in wrong ways. So when riches are a thing of the past, friends may receive you into a home that will be forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is faithful with little things is faithful with big things also. He that is not honest with little things is not honest with big things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have not been faithful with riches of this world, who will trust you with true riches?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have not been faithful in that which belongs to another person, who will give you things to have as your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No servant can have two bosses. He will hate the one and love the other. Or, he will be faithful to one and not faithful to the other. You cannot be faithful to God and to riches at the same time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers heard all these things. They loved money so they made fun of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “You are the kind of people who make yourselves look good before other people. God knows your hearts. What men think is good is hated in the eyes of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until John came, you had the writings of the Law and of the early preachers. From that time until now the Good News of the holy nation of God has been preached. Everyone is pushing his way in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one small part of a word in the Law to be of no more use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another woman is not faithful in marriage and is guilty of sex sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There was a rich man who dressed in purple linen clothes everyday. He lived like a king would live with the best of food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a poor man named Lazarus who had many bad sores. He was put by the door of the rich man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wanted the pieces of food that fell from the table of the rich man. Even dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The poor man who asked for food died. He was taken by the angels into the arms of Abraham. The rich man died also and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In hell the rich man was in much pain. He looked up and saw Abraham far away and Lazarus beside him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cried out and said, ‘Father Abraham, take pity on me. Send Lazarus. Let him put the end of his finger in water and cool my tongue. I am in much pain in this fire.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said, ‘My son, do not forget that when you were living you had your good things. Lazarus had bad things. Now he is well cared for. You are in pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And more than all this, there is a big deep place between us. No one from here can go there even if he wanted to go. No one can come from there.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the rich man said, ‘Father, then I beg you to send Lazarus to my father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have five brothers. Let him tell them of these things, or they will come to this place of much pain also.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said, ‘They have the Writings of Moses and of the early preachers. Let them hear what they say.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the rich man said, ‘No, Father Abraham. If someone goes to them from the dead, they will be sorry for their sins and turn from them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham said to him, ‘If they do not listen to Moses and to the early preachers, they will not listen even if someone is raised from the dead.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to His followers, “For sure, things will come that will make people sin. But it is bad for the person who makes someone else sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be better for him to have a large rock put around his neck and be thrown into the sea, than that he should cause one of these little ones to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Watch yourselves! If your brother sins, speak sharp words to him. If he is sorry and turns from his sin, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What if he sins against you seven times in one day? If he comes to you and says he is sorry and turns from his sin, forgive him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers said to the Lord, “Give us more faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “If your faith was as a mustard seed, you could say to this tree, ‘Be pulled out of the ground and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What if you owned a servant who was working in the field or taking care of sheep? Would you say to him when he came in from his work, ‘Come and sit down to eat?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, instead you would say, ‘Get my supper ready. Dress yourself and care for me until I am through eating and drinking. Then you can eat and drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does the servant get thanks for doing what he was told to do? I am sure he does not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the same with you also. When you do everything you have been told to do, you must say, ‘We are not any special servants. We have done only what we should have done.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went on His way to Jerusalem. He was passing between the countries of Samaria and Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He was going into one of the towns, ten men with a bad skin disease came to Him. They stood a little way off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They called to Him, “Jesus! Teacher! Take pity on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw them, He said, “Go and show yourselves to the religious leaders.” As they went, they were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them turned back when he saw he was healed. He thanked God with a loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got down on his face at the feet of Jesus and thanked Him. He was from the country of Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked, “Were there not ten men who were healed? Where are the other nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is this stranger from another country the only one who turned back to give thanks to God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Get up and go on your way. Your trust in God has healed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers asked when the holy nation of God would come. Jesus said to them, “The holy nation of God is not coming in such a way that can be seen with the eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will not be said, ‘See, here it is!’ or, ‘There it is!’ For the holy nation of God is in you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to His followers, “The time will come when you will wish you could see the Son of Man for one day. But you will not be able to.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will say to you, ‘He is here,’ or, ‘He is there,’ but do not follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Son of Man comes, He will be as lightning that shines from one part of the sky to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before that, He must suffer many hard things. The people of this day will have nothing to do with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As it was in the time of Noah, so will it be when the Son of Man comes back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People ate and drank. They married and were given in marriage. They did these things until the day Noah went into the large boat. Then the flood came and killed all the people on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the same in the time of Lot. People ate and drank. They bought and sold. They planted and built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the day Lot left the city of Sodom, fire and sulphur came down from heaven like rain. It killed all the people of Sodom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It will be the same on the day when the Son of Man comes again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day the man who is on top of a house should not come down to take his things out of the house. In the same way, the man who is in the field should not go back to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who wants to keep his life will have it taken away from him. He who loses his life will have it given back to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, on that night there will be two men in the same bed. One of them will be taken. The other will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding grain together. One of them will be taken. The other will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two men will be working in a field. One will be taken. The other will be left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked Jesus, “Where will this happen?” He said to them, “Birds also gather where there is a dead body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them a picture-story to show that men should always pray and not give up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “There was a man in one of the cities who was head of the court. His work was to say if a person was guilty or not. This man was not afraid of God. He did not respect any man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that city there was a woman whose husband had died. She kept coming to him and saying, ‘Help me! There is someone who is working against me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For awhile he would not help her. Then he began to think, ‘I am not afraid of God and I do not respect any man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will see that this woman whose husband has died gets her rights because I get tired of her coming all the time.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “Listen to the words of the sinful man who is head of the court.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will not God make the things that are right come to His chosen people who cry day and night to Him? Will He wait a long time to help them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, He will be quick to help them. But when the Son of Man comes, will He find faith on the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told another picture-story to some people who trusted in themselves and thought they were right with God. These people did not think well of other men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Two men went up to the house of God to pray. One of them was a proud religious law-keeper. The other was a man who gathered taxes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keeper stood and prayed to himself like this, ‘God, I thank You that I am not like other men. I am not like those who steal. I am not like those who do things that are wrong. I am not like those who do sex sins. I am not even like this tax-gatherer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I go without food two times a week so I can pray better. I give one-tenth part of the money I earn.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man who gathered taxes stood a long way off. He would not even lift his eyes to heaven. But he hit himself on his chest and said, ‘God, have pity on me! I am a sinner!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, this man went back to his house forgiven, and not the other man. For whoever makes himself look more important than he is will find out how little he is worth. Whoever does not try to honor himself will be made important.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People took their little children to Jesus so He could put His hand on them. When His followers saw it, they spoke sharp words to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called the followers to Him and said, “Let the little children come to Me. Do not try to stop them. The holy nation of God is made up of ones like these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, whoever does not receive the holy nation of God as a child will not go into the holy nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A leader of the people asked Jesus, “Good Teacher, what must I do to have life that lasts forever?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? There is only One Who is good. That is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the Laws. You must not do any sex sins. You must not kill another person. You must not steal. You must not tell a lie about someone else. Respect your father and your mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader said, “I have obeyed all these Laws since I was a boy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, He said to the leader of the people, “There is still one thing you need to do. Sell everything you have. Give the money to poor people. Then you will have riches in heaven. Come and follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the leader heard this, he was very sad because he had many riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that he was very sad, He said, “It is hard for those with riches to go into the holy nation of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to go into the holy nation of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who heard this, said, “Then who can be saved from the punishment of sin?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “God can do things men cannot do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “See, we have left everything and have followed You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, anyone who has left his house or parents or brothers or wife or children because of the holy nation of God
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: will receive much more now. In the time to come he will have life that lasts forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took the twelve followers to one side and said, “See! We are going up to Jerusalem. All the things the early preachers wrote about the Son of Man are going to happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be given over to the people who are not Jews. He will be made fun of. He will be hurt. He will be spit on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will beat Him and kill Him. After three days He will be raised again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers did not understand these words. The meaning of these words was hidden from them. They did not know what He said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was coming near Jericho. A blind man was sitting by the side of the road, begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He heard many people going by and asked what was happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was going by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he cried out and said, “Jesus, Son of David, have pity on me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people spoke sharp words to him and told him not to call out. But he cried out all the more, “Son of David, have pity on me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus stopped and told the people to bring the blind man to Him. When the man was near, Jesus asked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you want Me to do for you?” He answered, “Lord, I want to see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Then see! Your faith has healed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once he could see. He followed Jesus and gave thanks to God. All the people gave thanks to God when they saw it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went on to the city of Jericho and was passing through it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a rich man named Zaccheus. He was a leader of those who gathered taxes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zaccheus wanted to see Jesus but he could not because so many people were there and he was a short man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ran ahead and got up into a sycamore tree to see Him. Jesus was going by that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came to the place, He looked up and saw Zaccheus. He said, “Zaccheus, come down at once. I must stay in your house today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once he came down and was glad to have Jesus come to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people saw it, they began to complain among themselves. They said, “He is going to stay with a man who is known to be a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zaccheus stood up and said to the Lord, “Lord, see! Half of what I own I will give to poor people. And if I have taken money from anyone in a wrong way, I will pay him back four times as much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Today, a person has been saved in this house. This man is a Jew also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man came to look for and to save from the punishment of sin those who are lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they heard these things, Jesus told them a picture-story. Because He was near Jerusalem, they thought the holy nation of God would come at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said, “A leader of a country went to another country far away. A nation was to be given to him, then he would return home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called ten of the servants he owned. He gave them ten pieces of money and said to them, ‘Put this money to use until I return.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But other men in his country hated him. They sent men after him to tell him they did not want him as their king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had been given the other nation, he returned as king. He asked for his servants who had received the money to come to him. He wanted to know how much more they had after putting it to use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first one came and said, ‘Lord, the piece of money you gave me has made ten more pieces of money.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, ‘You are a good servant. You have been faithful in using a little. Now you will be leader over ten cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The second man came to him and said, ‘Lord, the piece of money you gave me has made five more pieces of money.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, ‘You are to be leader over five cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Another one came saying, ‘Lord, look! Here is your piece of money. I have kept it hid in a piece of cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was afraid of you. You are a hard man. You take what you have not put down. You gather where you have not planted.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king said to him, ‘By the words from your own mouth I must say that you are guilty. You are a sinful servant. You knew I was a hard man. You knew I take what I have not put down. You knew I gather where I have not planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did you not put my money in the bank? Then when I came back I could have had my own money and what the bank paid for using it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he said to those who were standing by, ‘Take the piece of money from him and give it to the one who has ten pieces of money.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, ‘Lord, he already has ten pieces of money.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I tell you, he who has, to him will be given more. To him who does not have, even the little he has will be taken from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Bring here those who hated me and did not want me to be their king and kill them in front of me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had finished the picture-story, He went on ahead of them up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus was coming near the towns of Bethphage and Bethany by the Mount of Olives, He sent two of His followers on ahead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Go into the town ahead of you. There you will find a young donkey tied. No man has ever sat on it. Let it loose and bring it to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you letting it loose?’ say to him, ‘Because the Lord needs it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were sent found everything as Jesus had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were letting the young donkey loose, the owners said to them, “Why are you letting the young donkey loose?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “The Lord needs it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought it to Jesus. They put their coats on the donkey and they put Jesus on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was going, they put their coats down on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was near the city and ready to go down the Mount of Olives. The many people who were following Him began to sing with loud voices and give thanks for all the powerful works they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Great and honored is the King Who comes in the name of the Lord. There is peace and greatness in the highest heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the proud religious law-keepers who were in among the people said to Jesus, “Teacher, speak sharp words to Your followers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I tell you that if these did not speak, the very stones would call out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came near the city, He cried as He saw it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “If you had only known on this great day the things that make peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time is coming when those who hate you will dig earth and throw it up around you making a wall. They will shut you in from every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will destroy you and your children with you. There will not be one stone on another. It is because you did not know when God visited you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went into the house of God. He made those leave who were buying and selling there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer.’ ‘But you have made it a place of robbers.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus taught each day in the house of God. But the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law and other leaders of the people tried to think of some way they could kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They could not find a way because the people were always near Him listening to Him teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He was teaching and preaching the Good News, the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law and the elders came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Tell us, by what right and power are You doing these things? Who gave You the right and the power?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question also. You answer Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to themselves, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ then all the people will throw stones at us because they believe John was one who spoke for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said that they did not know where John’s baptism came from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “And I will not tell you where I get the right and the power to do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus began to tell the people a picture-story, saying, “There was a man who planted a grape-field. He rented it to farmers. Then he went to a country far away for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the time of gathering fruit he sent one of his servants to the farmers to get some of the fruit. But the farmers beat him and sent him away without fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent another servant. The farmers beat him also. They made it very hard for him and sent him away without fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent a third servant. They hurt him and threw him out of the grape-field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the owner of the grape-field said, ‘What should I do? I will send my much-loved son. They might respect him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmers saw the son. They said to themselves, ‘This is the one who will get everything when the owner dies. Let us kill him, and we will get everything.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put him out of the grape-field and killed him. Now what will the owner of the grape-field do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will come and kill those farmers. Then he will rent the grape-field to other farmers.”
When they heard this, they said, “May this never be done!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at them and said, “What does this writing mean, ‘The Stone that was put aside by the workmen has become the most important Stone in the building’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever falls on this Stone will be broken. And on the one it falls, it will make him like dust.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this time the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law tried to take Jesus, but they were afraid of the people. These leaders knew Jesus had told this picture-story against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They watched Jesus and they sent men who pretended to be good people to watch Him. They wanted to trap Him in something He said. Then they could give Him over to the leader of the people who had the right and the power to say what to do with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These men who were sent asked Jesus, “Teacher, we know what You say and teach is right. We know You do not show more respect to one person than to another. We know You teach the truth about God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it right for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew they were trying to trap Him. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Show Me a piece of money. Whose picture is this? Whose name is on it?” And they said, “Caesar’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Pay to Caesar the things that belong to Caesar. Pay to God the things that belong to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They could find nothing wrong with what He taught. They were surprised and wondered about what He told the people, so they said nothing more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people from the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead came to Jesus. They asked Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us in the Law, ‘If a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, then his brother must marry her. He should have children for his brother who died.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven brothers. The first had a wife but died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second brother took her for his wife. He died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third brother took her for his wife. In the same way all seven took her for a wife. They all died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman died also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When people are raised from the dead, whose wife will she be? All seven brothers had her for a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “People of this earth marry and are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who have the right to have that life and are raised from the dead do not marry and are not given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cannot die anymore. They are as the angels and are sons of God. They are children who have been raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the dead being raised, even Moses spoke of that when he told of the burning bush. There he calls the Lord, the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He is not the God of the dead. He is the God of the living. All live for Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the teachers of the Law said, “Teacher, You have spoken well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that they were afraid to ask Him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “How do they say that Christ is the Son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David himself said in the Book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to My Lord, “Sit at my right side
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I make those who hate You a place to rest Your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David calls Him, ‘Lord!’ Then how can He be his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people were listening. He said to His followers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look out for the teachers of the Law. They like to walk around in long coats. They like to have people speak words of respect to them in the center of town where people gather. They like the important seats in the places of worship. They like the important places at big suppers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They take houses from poor women whose husbands have died. They cover up their actions by making long prayers. They will be punished all the more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked up and saw rich men putting their money into the money box in the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw a poor woman whose husband had died. She put in two very small pieces of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I tell you the truth, this poor woman has put in more than all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have put in a little of the money they had no need for. She is very poor and has put in all she had. She has put in what she needed for her own living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people were talking about the house of God. They were saying that the stones were beautiful and that many gifts had been given. Jesus said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for these things you see, all these stones will be thrown down. Not one will be left on another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked Jesus, “Teacher, when will this take place? What are we to look for to show us these things are about to happen?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Be careful that no one leads you the wrong way. For many people will come in My name. They will say, ‘I am the Christ.’ The time is near. Do not follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you hear of wars and fighting in different places, do not be afraid. These things have to happen first, but the end is not yet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Nations will have wars with other nations. Countries will fight against countries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth will shake and break apart in different places. There will be no food. There will be bad diseases among many people. Very special things will be seen in the sky that will make people much afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But before all this happens, men will take hold of you and make it very hard for you. They will give you over to the places of worship and to the prisons. They will bring you in front of kings and the leaders of the people. This will all be done to you because of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be a time for you to tell about Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not think about what you will say ahead of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will give you wisdom in what to say and I will help you say it. Those who are against you will not be able to stop you or say you are wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will be handed over by your parents and your brothers and your family and your friends. They will kill some of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All men will hate you because of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet not one hair of your head will be lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But stay true and your souls will have life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you see armies all around Jerusalem, know that it will soon be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in the country of Judea must run to the mountains. Those in the city must leave at once. Those in the country must not go into the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will be punished in these hard days. All things will happen as it is written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It will be hard for women who will soon be mothers. It will be hard for those feeding babies in those days. It will be very hard for the people in the land and anger will be brought down on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will be killed by the sword. They will be held in prison by all nations. Jerusalem will be walked over by the people who are not Jews until their time is finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There will be special things to look for in the sun and moon and stars. The nations of the earth will be troubled and will not know what to do. They will be troubled at the angry sea and waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hearts of men will give up because of being afraid of what is coming on the earth. The powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with power and much greatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When these things begin to happen, lift up your heads because you have been bought by the blood of Christ and will soon be free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them a picture-story. He said, “Look at the fig tree and all the other trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you see their leaves coming out, you know summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when you see these things happening, you will know the holy nation of God is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, that the people of this day will not die before all these things happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Heaven and earth will pass away, but My Words will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch yourselves! Do not let yourselves be loaded down with too much eating and strong drink. Do not be troubled with the cares of this life. If you do, that day will come on you without you knowing it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will come on all people over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sure you watch. Pray all the time so that you may be able to keep from going through all these things that will happen and be able to stand before the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyday Jesus taught in the house of God. At night He went to the Mount of Olives and stayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning all the people came to the house of God to hear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time for the supper of bread without yeast was near. It was the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders and the teachers of the Law looked for a way to kill Jesus. But they were afraid of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan came into the heart of Judas who was called Iscariot. He was one of the twelve followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas went away and talked with the religious leaders and the leaders of the people. He talked about how he might hand Jesus over to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were glad and promised to pay him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas promised to do this and then looked for a way to hand Jesus over when there were no people around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day of bread without yeast came. It was the day when the lamb had to be killed and given on the altar in worship in the house of God. It was the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent Peter and John and said, “Go and get this special supper ready for us that we may eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Where do You want us to get it ready?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “See, when you go into the city, you will meet a man carrying a jar of water. Follow him into the house where he goes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher asks you, “Where is the room you keep for friends where I may eat this special supper with My followers?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take you to a large room on the second floor with everything in it. Make it ready for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went and found everything as Jesus had said. They got ready for the special supper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time came, Jesus sat down with the twelve followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I have wanted very much to eat this special supper with you to remember how the Jews left Egypt. I have wanted to eat this with you before I suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you, I will not eat this special supper again until its true meaning is completed in the holy nation of God.”
