verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took the cup and gave thanks. He said, “Take this and pass it to each one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say to you that I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the holy nation of God comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took bread and gave thanks and broke it in pieces. He gave it to them, saying, “This is My body which is given for you. Do this to remember Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, after they had finished the bread, He took the cup. He said, “This cup is My blood of the New Way of Worship which is given for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, the hand of the one who will give Me over to the leaders of the country is on the table with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will be taken this way because it has been in God’s plan. But it is bad for that man who hands Him over!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to ask each other which of them would do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They started to argue among themselves about who was thought to be the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “The kings of the nations show their power to the people. Those who have power over the people are given names of honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you will not be like that. Let the greatest among you be as the least. Let the leader be as the one who cares for others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is greater, the one who is eating at the table, or the one who is caring for him? Is it not the one who is eating at the table? But I am here with you as One Who cares for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You have stayed with Me through all the hard things that have come to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As My Father has given Me a holy nation, I will give you the right
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to eat and drink at My table in My holy nation. You will sit on thrones and judge the twelve family groups of the Jewish nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Simon, Simon, listen! Satan has wanted to have you. He will divide you as wheat is divided from that which is no good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have prayed for you. I have prayed that your faith will be strong and that you will not give up. When you return, you must help to make your brothers strong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, I am ready to go to prison and to die with You!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I tell you, Peter, a rooster will not crow today before you will say three times that you do not know Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I sent you without money or bag or shoes. Did you need anything?” They said, “Nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “But now whoever has a money-bag and a bag for food should take it. Whoever does not have a sword should sell his coat and buy one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, that what has been written about Me must happen. It says, ‘They thought of Him as One Who broke the Law.’ What is told about Me must happen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Lord, look, we have two swords.” He answered, “That is enough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came out of the room. Then He went to the Mount of Olives as He had been doing. The followers went with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He got there, He said to them, “Pray that you will not be tempted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He walked away from them about as far as a stone can be thrown. There He got down with His face on the ground and prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Father, if it can be done, take away what must happen to Me. Even so, not what I want, but what You want.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel from heaven came and gave Him strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His heart was much troubled and He prayed all the more. Water ran from His face like blood and fell to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus got up after praying, He went back to the followers. He found them sleeping because of so much sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray that you will not be tempted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was speaking, Judas came walking ahead of many people. He was one of the twelve followers. He came near to Jesus to kiss Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you handing over the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those around Jesus saw what was going to happen and asked, “Lord, should we fight with our swords?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them hit a servant who was owned by the head religious leader and cut off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Stop! This is enough.” And He put His hand on his ear and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the religious leaders and the leaders of the house of God and the other leaders who came to Him, “Have you come with swords and sticks to take Me, as if I were a robber?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I was with you everyday in the house of God, you never took hold of Me. But now is the time you are to come and you have come in the dark.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they led Jesus away to the house of the head religious leader. Peter followed a long way behind Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They built a fire in the yard and sat down. Peter sat down with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the servant-girls saw Peter as he sat by the fire and looked right at him. She said, “This man was with Jesus also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter lied and said, “Woman, I do not know Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After awhile another person saw him and said, “You are one of them also.” Peter said, “No, sir, I am not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About an hour later another person said the same thing, “For sure, this man was with Jesus also because he is from Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Sir, I do not know what you are saying.” And at once, while he was talking, a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord turned and looked at Peter. He remembered the Lord had said, “Before a rooster crows, you will say three times that you do not know Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter went outside and cried with a troubled heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who watched Jesus so He could not get away made fun of Him and beat Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They covered His eyes with a cloth and asked Him, “Tell us who hit You!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said many other bad things against Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was morning the leaders of the people and the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law got together. They took Jesus to the court of the religious leader. They said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us if you are the Christ.” He said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I ask you something, you will not tell Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the All-powerful God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all said, “Then are You the Son of God?” He said, “You say that I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “What other word do we need against Him? We have heard Him say this with His own mouth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the many people got up and took Jesus to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to tell things against Him, saying, “We have found this Man leading the people of our nation in a wrong way. He has been telling them not to pay taxes to Caesar. He has been saying He is Christ, a King.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate asked Jesus, “Are You the King of the Jews?” He said, “What you said is true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to the religious leaders and to the people, “I find nothing wrong in this Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They became more angry. They said, “He makes trouble among the people. He has been teaching over all the country of Judea, starting in Galilee and now here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard the word, Galilee, he asked, “Is the Man from Galilee?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Pilate knew Jesus belonged in the country where Herod was king, he sent Him to Herod. Herod was in Jerusalem at that time also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod was very glad when he saw Jesus because he had wanted to see Him for a long time. He had heard many things about Him and had hoped to see Him do some powerful work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod talked to Jesus and asked many things. But Jesus said nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders and the teachers of the Law were standing there. They said many false things against Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod and his soldiers were very bad to Jesus and made fun of Him. They put a beautiful coat on Him and sent Him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day Pilate and Herod became friends. Before that they had worked against each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate called the religious leaders and the leaders of the people and the people together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You brought this Man to me as one that leads the people in the wrong way. I have asked Him about these things in front of you. I do not find Him guilty of the things you say against Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod found nothing wrong with Him because he sent Him back to us. There is no reason to have Him put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will punish Him and let Him go free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every year at the time of the special supper, Pilate would let one person who was in prison go free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all cried out together with a loud voice, “Take this Man away! Let Barabbas go free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Barabbas had killed some people and had made trouble against the leaders of the country. He had been put in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate wanted to let Jesus go free so he talked to them again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they cried out, “Nail Him to a cross! Nail Him to a cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them the third time, “Why, what bad thing has He done? I have found no reason to put Him to death. I will punish Him and let Him go free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept on crying out with loud voices saying that He must be nailed to a cross. Their loud voices got what they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said that it should be done as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate let the man go free who had made trouble against the leaders of the country and who had killed people. He gave Jesus over to them to do with as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They led Jesus away. A man named Simon was coming in from the country of Cyrene and they made him carry the cross following behind Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people followed Jesus. There were women who cried and had sorrow for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned to them and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem do not cry for Me. Cry for yourselves and your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen! The days are coming when they will say, ‘Those who have never had children are happy. Those whose bodies have never given birth are happy. Those who have never fed babies are happy.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us.’ They will say to the hills, ‘Cover us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they do these things to a green tree, what will they do when it is dry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two other men were led away with Jesus to be put to death also. These men had done things making them guilty of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the place called Calvary, they nailed Jesus to a cross. The other two men were nailed to crosses also. One was on the right side of Jesus and the other was on His left side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Father, forgive them. They do not know what they are doing.” And they divided His clothes by drawing names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people stood around looking on. The leaders were there with them making fun of Jesus. They said, “He saved others, let Him save Himself if He is the Christ, the Chosen One of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers made fun of Him also. They put sour wine before Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These words were written in the Greek and Latin and Hebrew languages above His head: “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the men who was guilty of death who was on a cross beside Jesus spoke bad words to Him. He said, “If You are the Christ, save Yourself and us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other man on a cross spoke sharp words to the one who made fun of Jesus. He said, “Are you not afraid of God? You are also guilty and will be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are suffering and we should, because of the wrong we have done. But this Man has done nothing wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when You come into Your holy nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “For sure, I tell you, today you will be with Me in Paradise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was dark over all the earth from noon until three o’clock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun did not shine. In the house of God the curtain was torn in two pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Father, into Your hands I give My spirit.” When He said this, He died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the soldier saw what had happened, he thanked God. He said, “For sure, He was a good man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the many people who came together to see the things that were done, went away beating themselves on their chests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All His friends and the women who had come with Him from Galilee stood a long way off watching these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man named Joseph who belonged to the court. He was a good man and one who did right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man did not agree with what the court did. He was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews. He was looking for the holy nation of God to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took it down and put it in linen cloth. It was laid in a grave which had been cut out in the side of a rock. This grave had never been used.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was time to get ready for the Day of Rest which was about to begin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed behind. They saw the grave and how His body was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went back and got some spices and perfumes ready. But they rested on the Day of Rest as the Law said to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning on the first day of the week, the women went to the grave taking the spices they had made ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found the stone had been pushed away from the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went in but they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they wondered about what had happened, they saw two men standing by them in shining clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were very much afraid and got down with their faces to the ground. The men said to them, “Why do you look for the living One among those who are dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here. He is risen. Do you not remember what He said to you when He was yet in Galilee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘The Son of Man must be given over into the hands of sinful men. He must be nailed to a cross. He will rise again three days later.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They remembered what He had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came back from the grave, they told all these things to the eleven followers and to all the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were Mary Magdalene and Joanna and Mary the mother of James. Other women who were with them told these things to the followers also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their words sounded like foolish talk. The followers did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter got up and ran to the grave. He got down to look in and saw only the linen clothes. Then he went away, surprised about what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same day two of His followers were going to the town of Emmaus. It was about a two-hour walk from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They talked of all these things that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were talking together, Jesus Himself came and walked along with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Something kept their eyes from seeing Who He was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What are you talking about as you walk?” They stood still and looked sad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, whose name was Cleopas, said to Him, “Are you the only one visiting Jerusalem who has not heard of the things that have happened here these days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “What things?” They answered, “The things about Jesus of Nazareth. He was the great One Who spoke for God. He did powerful works and spoke powerful words in the sight of God and the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the religious leaders and the leaders of the people gave Him over to be killed and nailed Him to a cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We were hoping He was the One Who was going to make the Jewish people free. But it was three days ago when these things happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Some of the women of our group have surprised us and made us wonder. They went to the grave early this morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not find His body. They came back saying they had seen angels in a special dream who said that He was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those who were with us went to the grave and found it as the women had said. But they did not see Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “You foolish men. How slow you are to believe what the early preachers have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not Christ have to go through these hard things to come into His shining-greatness?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus kept on telling them what Moses and all the early preachers had said about Him in the Holy Writings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the town where they were going, Jesus acted as if He were going farther.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said to Him, “Stay with us. It will soon be evening. The day is about over.” He went in to stay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He sat at the table with them, He took the bread and gave thanks and broke it. Then He gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their eyes were opened and they knew Him. Then He left them and could not be seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to each other, “Were not our hearts filled with joy when He talked to us on the road about what the Holy Writings said?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they got up at once and went back to Jerusalem. They found the eleven followers together and others with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “For sure the Lord is risen and was seen by Simon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they told what had happened on the road and how they came to know Him when He broke the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they talked, Jesus Himself stood among them. He said, “May you have peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were afraid and full of fear. They thought they saw a spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Why are you afraid? Why do you have doubts in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at My hands and My feet. See! It is I, Myself! Touch Me and see for yourself. A spirit does not have flesh and bones as I have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had said this, He showed them His hands and feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They still wondered. It was hard for them to believe it and yet it made them happy. Then He said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave Jesus a piece of fish that had been cooked and some honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took it and ate it in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “These are the things I told you while I was yet with you. All things written about Me in the Law of Moses and in the Books of the early preachers and in the Psalms must happen as they said they would happen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He opened their minds to understand the Holy Writings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “It is written that Christ should suffer and be raised from the dead after three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be preached that men must be sorry for their sins and turn from them. Then they will be forgiven. This must be preached in His name to all nations beginning in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to tell what you have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See! I will send you what My Father promised. But you are to stay in Jerusalem until you have received power from above.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus led them out as far as Bethany. Then He lifted up His hands and prayed that good would come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while He was praying that good would come to them, He went from them (and was taken up to heaven and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they worshiped Him). Then they went back to Jerusalem with great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spent all their time in the house of God honoring and giving thanks to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
